Sarah Melanie Gibbons, the daughter of Linda and Richard Gibbons of Fairfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Richard Charles McLaughlin, a son of Joanne and Richard T. McLaughlin of Williston Park, N.Y. The ceremony was performed at the Fordham University Church in the Bronx by the Rev. Joseph A. O'Hare, the president emeritus of the university and a Roman Catholic priest.
The bride and bridegroom met at Fordham, from which they graduated.

Mrs. McLaughlin, 28, teaches fourth grade at Shuang Wen School, a dual-language public school -- English and Mandarin Chinese -- in Manhattan. She received a master's degree in teaching from Sacred Heart University in Fairfield, Conn.

Her father is of counsel at Wake, See, Dimes, Bryniczka, Day & Bloom, a law firm in Westport, Conn. Her mother is an administrative assistant to the director of human resources for the Wilton Board of Education in Connecticut.
Mr. McLaughlin, 27, is a program director for two rock-music channels at Sirius Satellite Radio in Manhattan.

His mother is the chief executive of the Ambulatory Surgery Center of Greater New York, an outpatient eye-surgery center in the Bronx. His father runs a patient transportation company and, until 1995, was a sergeant with the Bronx Task Force of the New York Police Department.
